summary: This document is an email chain from November 5, 2020, regarding a FOIA request (EOUSA-2021-000288) from a media company for records related to the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (20-CR-00330). The correspondence involves U.S. Attorney's Office personnel discussing the request, which seeks audio, video, photographic, and other records concerning Jeffrey Epstein, Maxwell, victims, witnesses, and properties. An Assistant U.S. Attorney states that materials in the requested categories are evidence in an ongoing investigation and pending case and have not been made public.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the criminal case (20 Cr. 330) and the FOIA request. The request seeks records related to her and Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as 'JE' in the FOIA request. The request seeks records related to him and Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Kevina Tidwell
persons.role: FOIA Requester (associated with Blue Ant Studios)
persons.context: Named in the email subject line as the point of contact for the FOIA request from Blue Ant Studios, a media company.

persons.name: Theodore B. Smith
persons.context: CC'd on the initial request email. His email address (TSmith4@usa.doj.gov) is listed. He is an AUSA for the Southern District of New York.

connections.description: Linked together in the FOIA request for records concerning victims, witnesses, and their properties, indicating their association in the alleged criminal activity.
Smith is an Assistant U.S. Attorney involved in the pending criminal case (USA v. Maxwell), representing the prosecution.

events.title: FOIA Request Correspondence
events.description: Email exchange regarding FOIA request EOUSA-2021-000288 from Blue Ant Studios (media company) for records related to the Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein cases.

events.title: Ongoing Criminal Case Against Maxwell
events.description: Reference to United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (AJN), as an ongoing investigation and pending criminal case.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: A media company (Blue Ant Studios, via Kevina Tidwell) filed a FOIA request (EOUSA-2021-000288) for audio, video, photographic, and other records related to Jeffrey Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, their victims, witnesses, and properties.

The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York stated that materials within the requested categories are evidence in an ongoing investigation and the pending criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (20-CR-00330) and have not been made public.
The correspondence indicates the government's position of withholding sensitive investigative materials related to the Epstein-Maxwell case from public FOIA release due to the active prosecution.
The email chain involves coordination between DOJ/EOUSA personnel and the SDNY U.S. Attorney's Office, specifically mentioning Assistant U.S. Attorney Theodore B. Smith.
